result.execSummary:
The defendant Lewis J McGee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.
Undergo random urine screens (no right to refuse screens, refusal will be treated as a positive test result) and HOC time could result from a positive test.
Agent to notify Court upon second positive test for drugs or alcohol.

No possession, use, sale, or distribution of any illegal drugs; no association with any location where illegal substances are consumed, packaged or sold.
No possession of any firearms or ammunition.
No operation of a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.

DNA sample and surcharge (unless previously done).
Pay all applicable fees of supervision.
Restitution set at $0.00.
All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Maintain or seek verifiable full time employment or education or vocational training.

Comply with all rules of probation.
Cooperate with agent.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lewis J McGee

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lewis J McGee in court.  Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court for Lewis J McGee.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Sentencing Hearing. Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 : Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered count 1 is dismissed but read in.

AS TO COUNT 2 : The court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 5 DAYS time served. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Absolute sobriety.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- No possession, use, sale, or distribution of any illegal drugs; no association with any location where illegal substances are consumed, packaged or sold.
- Undergo random urine screens (no right to refuse screens, refusal will be treated as a positive test result) and HOC time could result from a positive test.
- Agent to notify Court upon second positive test for drugs or alcohol.
- DNA sample and surcharge (unless previously done).
- Pay all applicable fees of supervision.
- No possession of any firearms or ammunition.
- Maintain or seek verifiable full time employment or education or vocational training.
- Comply with all rules of probation.
- Cooperate with agent.
- No operation of a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant to contact probation immediately.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8/30/22, FILED.
Received and filed:  Elements of Criminal Offenses
Received and filed: Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver
/Received and filed:  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Defendant Lewis J McGee in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Pretrial Conference.  Parties have reached an agreement. Amended Information filed. Defense and defendant are in agreement. 

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

As to Count 2 : Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant shall remain under Justice Point Supervision.  Court sets deadline for filing victim inpact statement for 3 days prior to sentencing hearing.

Case adjourned to Branch 9 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-4-2022, filed.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-10-2022

Defendant Lewis J McGee in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Court set the following filing deadlines with parties. State has until June 3rd, 2022 to provide discovery to the defense, except for crime lab reports. State has until July 18th, 2022, to provide the crime lab reports to the defense. Defense has until August 1st, 2022 to file any motions or change of plea forms. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lewis J McGee

Prior: 3959 North 69th Street, Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 05-19-2022.

10:42 AM Defendant Lewis J McGee in court in person with Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang who appears by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Bennett III.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 04-27-2022

Defendant Lewis J McGee in court by telephone with Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang who appears by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense requests a hearing. Defendant does not appear with video which is needed for identification. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Defendant to appear in person on the next date. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

SPD Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Court ordered no contact with BW.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lewis J McGee in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Lewis J McGee in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
